title: Calendar Missing when I attempt to add a Task
content:
Running Thunderbird 115.6.1 (64-bit) on Windows 10. I can add an EVENT to any of my 5 calendars in the dropdown. But when I try to add a TASK, only 4 calendars are offered. Naturally, it's the missing calendar (xxx@gmail.com) I need!

Suggestions would be deeply appreciated.

Thanks, Jeff
creator: jeffbauman

title: Email disappears about 20 seconds after read
content:
This occurs only on 1 out of 6 devices accessing the same account. -1 Windows 10, Thunderbird 115.6.1; *** -1 Windows 11, Thunderbird 115.6.1; -2 Zorin OS Thunderbird 115.6.1; -2 Androids gmail

All above devices access the same multiple accounts. The problem is the Windows 10 device, as it displays emails that have not been read in all accounts. The sent folders are empty on all accounts also.

The other devices do not have this problem as they show all emails. When a new email arrives, it is visible on all devices including Windows 10. However, if any device reads the email, and the status changes to "read", then about 20 seconds the email disappears on the Windows 10 device.

Logging into the email account via Firefox Browser, and the emails are all intact. I have ensured View/Threads/All has been selected, and still the problem persists. (I toggled this on the Win-11 machine and the display toggles the read on & off).

I deleted an account, and re-added the account, and as it synchronized only the unread emails displayed. I tried Account-Settings/Synchronization & Storage/Advance/Download to force download all. The process seemed to work, however, the results were the same, unable to see "read" emails.

My last resort will be to un-install Thunderbird from the Windows 10 device, and re-install, and setting up the emails again.

Any advice before re-installing would be appreciated.

Thanks in advance.
creator: jimwalker1960
